New Records: Georgia, ranked 74th in the FIFA rankings, achieved the biggest upset by FIFA rankings in European Championship history with a 2-0 win over Portugal, ranked sixth in the world.
Key Match Events: Khvicha Kvaratskhelia scored in the 2nd minute to give Georgia the lead.
Georges Mikautadze scored a penalty in the 57th minute to seal the win for Georgia.
Giorgi Mamardashvili made late saves to keep Portugal at bay.
Pre-Game Insights: Coach Willy Sagnol said that being the small team in the competition had no weight on their shoulders, allowing them to play without pressure.
Post-Match Reflections: Coach Willy Sagnol expressed pride in being Georgia's manager after their historic win.
Khvicha Kvaratskhelia said he was proud of the team's performance and that they can fight against everyone.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Georgia's win also means that England will line up against Slovakia, Romania will take on Netherlands, and Portugal will face Slovenia in the round of 16.
Cristiano Ronaldo was booked in the first half for arguing and failed to score in the group stage of a major international tournament for the first time in his career.
Others: Georgia's win marked the greatest result for the country since gaining independence from the Soviet Union in 1991.
The match was played at the VELTINS-Arena in Gelsenkirchen, Germany, in front of 49,616 spectators.
